intro: Zygophyllum gaetulum, commonly known as the desert morning glory, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Middle East and North Africa. It is a shrub or small tree with woody stems and is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. The plant produces small, showy flowers that are typically yellow or orange, which bloom in the early morning. Its leaves are usually small and succulent, helping to conserve water. Zygophyllum gaetulum is also known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and is often used in landscaping for its drought tolerance.
